keyword: how many calories are in sushi
title: How Many Calories Are in Sushi?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in sushi per piece, including breakdowns for carbs, protein, fat, and tips for different types like nigiri or rolls.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Sushi?
assumptions: Average nigiri sushi piece with white fish (e.g., tuna or snapper) and vinegared rice; ~25g total weight, no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (nigiri, maki, tempura), fish, rice portion, and preparation; restaurant vs. homemade differs. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One piece of average nigiri sushi has about 45 kcal, mostly from rice.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged sushi.

tweaks.label: Fatty fish like salmon instead of white fish
California roll piece (with avocado and crab)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one piece of sushi?
faqs.a: About 45 kcal for a standard nigiri piece with white fish.
Yes, mainly from riceâ€”around 6 g per piece, with minimal fiber.

faqs.q: How does sushi compare calorie-wise to other rolls?
faqs.a: Nigiri is lower (~45 kcal/piece); maki rolls average 40-50 kcal, tempura higher at 60+ kcal.
Typically 3-4 g per piece from fish or seafood, plus some from rice.

faqs.q: Does soy sauce add many calories to sushi?
faqs.a: 1 tsp adds ~10 kcal and boosts sodium; use sparingly for lower totals.
